title: Safe Editing
content:
Principles

  • Inspect before changing: ls, cat, stat
  • Prefer backups before bulk edits
  • Avoid destructive one-liners until you understand expansions
  • Use rm -i if you are unsure

Safe patterns

# 1) Preview what will match
ls *.log

# 2) If correct, then remove
rm -i *.log

Bulk replace without losing the original

cp config.conf config.conf.bak
# then edit config.conf

Use -- to end options

touch -- -weird
ls -- -weird
rm -- -weird
